name: Dynamic CTA
author: Gabriel Vieira

sections.description:
Tha Dynamic CTA plugins, put you under control of how to show the proper CTA guide by a flux and watching URL or terms.

Features include:

  • Create CTA with editor of WordPress admin, like a simple post
  • Define a flux and order of CTA to show
  • Watching terms or full URL to put a sot just on the right place

More information on using the plugin is available at http://dynamicctas.com/.

More info

  • About the plugin

Credits

  • Code by Gabriel Vieira
  • Designed by Delfino Vieira and Cristina F. da SIlva
sections.installation:
Installing manually:

  1. Unzip all files to the /wp-content/plugins/dynamic-ctas directory
  2. Log into WordPress admin and activate the ‘Dynamic CTA’ plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu
  3. Go to Dynamic CTAs in the left-hand menu to start using

Basic usage:

Follow these steps:

  1. Create your CTAs by clicking on left Word Press menu
  2. For each CTA you can put term to be watched or a full URL
  3. Go to the widgets section at Word Press menu and put the Dynamic CTA widget on the place that you wnat to show tour CTAs.
  4. That’ it! All pages are monitoring by widget and if some term or URL that you describe are match with current URL that your are visiting we mark than and the user will see on next page (or reload) the defined CTA.

More information on using the plugin is available here.
sections.changelog:
1.0.1

  • Fix a bug with uninstall process that can delete some posts
  • Improve the uninstall process to remove widget instances of Dynamic CTAs

1.0

  • First release

short_description: This plugin monitors and records each visitor browsing history on your website and publishes custom CTAs as the rules and flows defined by you.
